    #Fluid Dynamics
    2012

    Viscous fluid, with viscosity μ\muμ and density ρ\rhoρ flows along a straight circular pipe of radius RRR. The average velocity of the flow is UUU. Define a Reynolds number for the flow.

    The flow is driven by a constant pressure gradient −G>0-G>0−G>0 along the pipe and the velocity is parallel to the axis of the pipe with magnitude u(r)u(r)u(r) that satisfies
